items.details:
MAP TESTING

Great job on completing three MAP tests already! I’ve seen so much effort and progress from everyone—well done!

The last test will be Language Arts tomorrow.

To get ready:

Review your Grammar Workshop and Vocabulary Workshop books
Practice finding the main idea and supporting details in short passages
Think about word meanings—synonyms, antonyms, and using context clues
Review the 8 parts of speech (noun, pronoun, verb, adjective, adverb, preposition, conjunction, interjection)
Read carefully, do not rush, and check over your answers
Remember, do not get stressed about the tests. They are just a way for us to see how you are doing and how we can help you.

This is the final test—finish strong!

These YouTube videos might be helpful

8 Parts of speech.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=c3yJhw7R3fI 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E4_flsnd65Y&list=RDE4_flsnd65Y&start_radio=1  

These blookets might also help! Try to focus on the questions, not the game or just use the study mode with no games if you want to learn more

Parts of speech

https://play.blooket.com/play?hwId=68d4eb1d4a5d5ffc099a80d8

3rd Grade Language Arts

https://play.blooket.com/play?hwId=68d4ed45fc347e5200e419fb

Upcoming  Class Tests!
Monday, September 29th - Social Studies - Topic 1

Reading 

The story this week is 'Living in Deserts'. Please watch the video until you understand the story.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NxDlziHeNdg 

The spelling words for TOMORROW are:

active
bargain
gasp
loyal
resource
sensitive
struggle
value
vary
wander
capture
coward
exclaim
gloomy
insist
passage
restless
shallow
shatter
talent

I have assigned a story on What Lives in the Deserts? (DUE FRIDAY)

Please complete BEFORE TOMORROW!  Please answer every question and SUBMIT.

 Go to www.readworks.org/student 

Enter our class code YU6GQ2
Your password is 1234 unless you already changed it

Math

No book homework, but tomorrow is the math MAP test.

Please have your child practice a little Khan Academy math each night at https://www.khanacademy.org/join/VK6QDS9E to help strengthen their skills.

Korean 

Pages 115-119 and 20-33 in the Korean textbook and activity book.

Chinese

You need to write the words' student/boy/girl' twice before the next class.

Language Arts 

Complete pages 36-41 in the Vocabulary workshop book.
